## Useful commands and navigation in VS Code

-   Access the **command palette** in VS code: `Ctrl + Shift  + p`

+--------+-----+-------------------+-----+--------------+-----+--------------------------------------------------------+-----+-------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Prefix |     | Mode Name         |     | Scope        |     | Description                                            |     | Example                                                           |
+========+=====+===================+=====+==============+=====+========================================================+=====+===================================================================+
| `>`    |     | Command Mode      |     | Global       |     | Run VS Code commands                                   |     | `> settings`                                                      |
|        |     |                   |     |              |     |                                                        |     |                                                                   |
|        |     |                   |     |              |     | This is the default mode.                              |     |                                                                   |
+--------+-----+-------------------+-----+--------------+-----+--------------------------------------------------------+-----+-------------------------------------------------------------------+
| `@`    |     | Symbol Navigation |     | Current file |     | Navigate to symbols, optionally sort or filter by type |     | \@ myFunc\                                                        |
|        |     |                   |     |              |     |                                                        |     | `@:` sorts objects by type, not by position in file like \@ does. |
+--------+-----+-------------------+-----+--------------+-----+--------------------------------------------------------+-----+-------------------------------------------------------------------+

-   **Cycle between open files** in the editor: `Ctrl + Tab`

-   **Navigate in the editor** to previous cursor positions (even between files):

    -   Go back to previous cursor position: `Alt + ←`

    -   Go forward to next cursor position: `Alt + →`

-   Toggle visibility of the terminal area: `ctrl + j`

-   **Making VS code like RStudio**'s window panes by placing the REPL in the editor area:

    -   `ctrl+shift+p` to open command panel

    -   Type `settings` and select the option *Preferences: Open User Settings* (not the JSON version)

    -   In the *Search settings* box: type `terminal defaultlocation` to filter down to the setting that we want to change.

    -   In *Terminal \> Integrated: Default Location*, select `Editor` in the dropdown menu.\
        You can now move the editor around freely by drag and drop of the window.

## Useful extensions

-   [Julia](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=julialang.language-julia) - Official support for the Julia language in VS code.
-   [R](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=REditorSupport.r) - Work with R in VS code.
-   [Python](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-python.python) - Python language support.
-   [LaTeX workshop](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=James-Yu.latex-workshop) - LaTeX support in VS code.
-   [vscode-icons](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscode-icons-team.vscode-icons) - brings nice symbols to folders and files.
-   [Subtle Match Brackets](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=rafamel.subtle-brackets) - nicer handling of matching brackets in the editor.
-   [Live Preview](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.live-server) - live preview of HTML directly in VS code.
-   [Markdown all in one](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=yzhang.markdown-all-in-one) - Markdown support in VS code.
-   [Quarto](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=quarto.quarto) - Quarto support.
-   [Code Runner](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.code-runner) - run code in many different languages in VS code (not needed to run Julia code however since it has its own runner in Julia for VS code extension).
-   [Excel Viewer](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=GrapeCity.gc-excelviewer) - Editors and previews for CSV files and Excel spreadsheets in Visual Studio Code.
-   [Git Lens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens) - supercharge your Git experience in VS code.
-   [VS code Spotify](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=shyykoserhiy.vscode-spotify) - Play music in VS code.
